section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > g. Coronavirus infections > 1) COVID-19 infection > (d) Non-respiratory manifestations of COVID-19

content.full_text: When the reason for the encounter/admission is a non-respiratory manifestation (e.g., viral enteritis) of COVID-19, assign code U07.1, COVID-19, as the principal/first-listed diagnosis and assign code(s) for the manifestation(s) as additional diagnoses. (Evidence: pg no: 30, L80-L83)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding COVID-19 when the primary reason for encounter is a non-respiratory manifestation (Evidence: pg no: 30, L80-L83)
key_concepts: Non-respiratory manifestation as reason for encounter (Evidence: pg no: 30, L81)
U07.1 as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 30, L82)
Manifestation codes as additional diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 30, L83)
Example of viral enteritis (Evidence: pg no: 30, L81)

detailed_rules.rule_text: U07.1 as principal diagnosis for non-respiratory manifestations (Evidence: pg no: 30, L82)
detailed_rules.explanation: When non-respiratory manifestation is the reason for encounter, COVID-19 should be sequenced first with manifestation codes as additional (Evidence: pg no: 30, L81-L83)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify non-respiratory manifestation as reason for encounter
